I am convinced that the Clintons look out across this land of ours and insofar as they are concerned they see nothing other than what they think are rubes, rednecks and buffoons that they can lie to, cheat and con. I suspect they privately laugh to themselves about how easily people are fooled and I suspect that even the Clintons are surprised about what they have gotten by with.

Dear Santa, please don't bother visiting the Netherlands this Xmas. The one and only Sinterklaas already brought us tons of presents on December 5th. You know we consider you a cheep Cola-copy anyway. Apart from that, the reindeer-stuff you do is cool. But please give the Dutch present to the children in Syria and Jemen

An investigation doesn't prove guilt. More times than not it leaves innocence. So live in a guilty until proven innocent society now. It's disgusting. OK, the FBI has 100 people investigating. Awesome. No indictment yet though. Never mind proof of guilt. PS I'm team Bernie all the way. I'm defending the process, not Hillary.

I would have done the same thing. I had an amnio in 1989. If something had been wrong, I would have terminated the pregnancy. I did not want my older 2 kids to have to perhaps eventually have to take care of a child with disabilities because Mom decided to wear a """"badge of honor"""". Sorry, folks, but that's what a lot of you ladies sound like when putting down someone that made a personal decision to terminate a pregnancy. Like somehow, you are special and deserve some medal because you made YOUR personal decision to continue with your pregnancy and anything otherwise is wrong because you have determined it to be so. That decision to have your child is yours, just like it was her decision to terminate. Her decision did not affect you in any way, so why make it personal.
